page.title: 02The People of Stonegate
page.content: About 400 people live in Stonegate. There is a small nucleus of settlement around the cross-roads,but the rest of the population is well scattered in farms and cottages. The population structure shows a mixture of age-groups - many families with young children as well as older citizens who have retired to the countryside. With the exception of farming,there are few sources of employment within the study area.The sewage works are visited regularly by workmen from outside the area. The Bridge Inn, railway station,Stonegate Stores and the haulage contractors employ only a small number of people. Many commute to London,and some work from their own homes. There is no significant problem of unemployment in the area.
